result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J Bullis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program but 
IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Counts 9 and 10

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with the victims or their residence unless they wish to have contact and No contact with the co-actors.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program but 
IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Count 10

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $27,273.14 joint and several - to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

AS OF 8/11/2016: It was granted Defendant pay restitution after his Extended Supervision out of prison wages at the rate of 25% jointly and severally.

records.addlTxt: restitution summary

Attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg in court.   Defendant Jesse J Bullis did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court waives the defendant's appearance. Defendant is not contesting the amount of restitution. Defense counsel is requesting that the payment of  restitution start after he starts his extended supervision. State presents statements has no objections. Court orders that the defendant pay restitution at the rate of 25% of his prison wages only jointly and severally.
Court's response to defendant's pro se request.
Restitution hearing on August 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jesse J Bullis in court, in custody, with attorney Michael S. Holzman.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Witnesses have been sequestered.  City of Muskego Detective Stephen Westphal sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Suha.  Cross examination by Attorney Holzman.  Redirect by Attorney Suha.  Recross by Attorney Holzman.  City of New Berlin Detective Scott Schmit sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Suha.  Cross examination by Attorney Holzman.  Redirect by Attorney Suha.  Village of Pewaukee Detective Craig Drummy sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Suha.  Cross examination by Attorney Holzman.  State recalls Detective Stephen Westphal, sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Suha.  Cross examination by Attorney Holzman.   State rests and moves for bind over.   Defense objects and moves to dismiss.   Attorney Holzman makes further motion to dismiss count 2.  Court denies the request.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
